# F8270 2024-12-05

## History & Physical

::::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
**HPI**: 78M with NICM s/p DC-ICD with amiodarone intolerance presents for PVC ablation

**PMHx**: NICM, HFimpEF (10% in 2019 to 40% in 2023), non-obstructive CAD, cardiogenic shock & VT storm s/p DC-ICD in 2011, amiodarone-induced hypothyroidism, HTN, HLD, pxAF, CKDIII

**Social**: Lives with Wife in Idaho
 
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
**Meds**: eplerenone, empagliflozin, digoxin 125, apixaban, atorvastatin, amiodarone 200, sacubitril-valsartan

**Exam**: 130s/70s, HR 70s, 95% on room air. NAD, AOx4. Systolic murmur II/VI. Clear lungs. Gait intact. 

**Studies**:  TTE in 09/2024 with LVEF of 35%, ++LA, +AS, +AI. CIED interrogation with ~70% AP and ~20% VP and 0% AF/AMS episodes.
:::

# Ablation {background-color='{{< brand color primary >}}'}

## Ablation details

- Used RF energy with a non-irrigated 4 mm tip catheter, power-limited at 50W with a target of 60ËšC $\rightarrow$ *Sapphire*

- Ran into temperature limits, leading to low power output (5-15W)

- Switched to irrigated catheter $\rightarrow$ *FlexAbility* with improved applied energy

# Hospital Course

## Summary

1. Day of presentation has device interrogation showing 0% AF burden, with 60-70% atrial pacing and 20-30% ventricular pacing with intact conduction.

1. Peri-annular PVC on posteroseptal side of tricuspid valve seen on ECG during EPS. Ablation performed using non-irrigated $\rightarrow$ irrigated catheter

1. Subsequent increase to 100% ventricular pacing without signs of native conduction

1. Following day recieved CRT-D upgrade and then discharged in appropriate condition
